mla package¶

Submodules¶

mla.analysis module¶

Docstring

class mla.analysis.Analysis(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Abstract class defining the structure of analysis classes.

Analysis classes based on this one have functions to produce trials one at a time for troubleshooting, and a function produce_and_minimize to run multiple trials.

abstract evaluate_ts(events: numpy.ndarray, event_model: mla.models.EventModel, *args, **kwargs) → numpy.array¶

Evaluates the test statistic for some events given an event model.

abstract minimize_ts(events: numpy.ndarray, event_model: mla.models.EventModel, *args, **kwargs) → Dict[str, float]¶

Finds the params that minimize the test statistic for some events.

abstract produce_and_minimize(event_model: mla.models.EventModel, n_trials: int, *args, **kwargs) → numpy.ndarray¶

Generates events and finds the best fit params n_trials times.

abstract produce_trial(event_model: mla.models.EventModel, *args, **kwargs) → numpy.ndarray¶

Generates some events based on the given event model.

class mla.analysis.PsAnalysis(source: Optional[Dict[str, float]] = None, injector: Optional[mla.injectors.PsInjector] = None)¶

Bases: mla.analysis.Analysis

A basic point-source analysis class.

The is a time integrated analysis class that is useful for fitting the number of signal events and spectral index of a given a source and a time- integrated neutrino flux at the source.

injector¶

An injector object used to produce trial events from a given event model.

Type

injectors.PsInjector

evaluate_ts(events: numpy.ndarray, event_model: mla.models.EventModel, ns: float, gamma: float, n_events: Optional[int] = None, preprocessing: Tuple[List[scipy.interpolate.fitpack2.UnivariateSpline], numpy.array] = None) → numpy.array¶

minimize_ts(events: numpy.ndarray, event_model: mla.models.EventModel, test_ns: float, test_gamma: float, gamma_bounds: Tuple[float] = (- 4, - 1), **kwargs) → Dict[str, float]¶

Function info…

More function info…

Parameters

  • event_model – An object containing data and preprocessed parameters.

  • test_ns –

  • test_gamma –

Returns:

produce_and_minimize(event_model: mla.models.EventModel, n_trials: int, test_ns: float = 1, test_gamma: float = - 2, random_seed: Optional[int] = None, flux_norm: float = 0, gamma: float = - 2, nsignal: Optional[int] = None, sampling_width: Optional[float] = None, disable_time_filter: Optional[bool] = False, verbose: bool = False) → numpy.ndarray¶

Produces n trials and calculate a test statistic for each trial.

More function info…

Parameters

  • event_model – An object containing data and preprocessed parameters.

  • n_trials – The number of times to repeat the trial + evaluate_ts process.

  • test_ns – A guess for the number of signal events.

  • test_gamma – A guess for best fit spectral index of the signal.

  • random_seed – A seed value for the numpy RNG.

  • flux_norm – A flux normaliization to adjust weights.

  • gamma – A guess for best fit spectral index of the signal.

  • nsignal – How many signal events(Will overwrite flux_norm)

  • sampling_width – The bandwidth around the source declination to cut events.

  • disable_time_filter – do not cut out events that is not in grl

  • verbose – A flag to print progress.

Returns

An array of test statistic values and their best-fit parameters for each trial.

produce_trial(event_model: mla.models.EventModel, flux_norm: float, reduced_sim: Optional[numpy.ndarray] = None, gamma: float = - 2, sampling_width: Optional[float] = None, nsignal: Optional[int] = None, random_seed: Optional[int] = None, disable_time_filter: Optional[bool] = False, verbose: bool = False) → numpy.ndarray¶

Produces a single trial of background+signal events based on inputs.

More function info…

Parameters

  • event_model – An object containing data and preprocessed parameters.

  • reduced_sim – Reweighted and pruned simulated events near the source declination.

  • flux_norm – A flux normaliization to adjust weights.

  • gamma – A spectral index to adjust weights.

  • nsignal – How many signal events(Will overwrite flux_norm)

  • sampling_width – The bandwidth around the source declination to cut events.

  • random_seed – A seed value for the numpy RNG.

  • disable_time_filter – do not cut out events that is not in grl

  • verbose – A flag to print progress.

Returns

An array of combined signal and background events.

class mla.analysis.TimeDependentPsAnalysis(source: Optional[Dict[str, float]], event_model: mla.models.EventModel, background_time_profile: Optional[Union[mla.time_profiles.GenericProfile, Tuple[float, float]]], signal_time_profile: Optional[Union[mla.time_profiles.GenericProfile, Tuple[float, float]]], test_background_time_profile: Optional[Union[mla.time_profiles.GenericProfile, Tuple[float, float]]], test_signal_time_profile: Optional[Union[mla.time_profiles.GenericProfile, Tuple[float, float]]], **kwargs)¶

mla.injectors module¶

The classes in this file are used to inject events for trials generation.

class mla.injectors.PsInjector(source: Dict[str, float])¶

Bases: object

A basic point-source injector.

This injector class assumes a source, a gaussian signal spatial pdf based on angular distance from the source, and declination-dependent background spatial pdf given by an event model.

source¶

The dictionary representation of a source.

Type

Dict[str, float]

background_spatial_pdf(events: numpy.ndarray, event_model: mla.models.EventModel) → numpy.array¶

Calculates the background probability of events based on their dec.

Uses the background_dec_spline() function from the given event_model to get the probabilities.

Parameters

  • events – An array of events including their declination.

  • event_model – Preprocessed data and simulation.

Returns

The value for the background space pdf for the given events decs.

inject_background_events(event_model: mla.models.EventModel) → numpy.ndarray¶

Injects background events for a trial.

Parameters

event_model – Preprocessed data and simulation.

Returns

An array of injected background events.

inject_nsignal_events(reduced_sim: numpy.ndarray, n: int) → numpy.ndarray¶

Function info…

Inject n signal events.

Parameters

  • n – Number of events.

Returns

inject_signal_events(reduced_sim: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray¶

Injects signal events for a trial.

Parameters

reduced_sim – Reweighted and pruned simulated events near the source declination.

Returns

An array of injected signal events.

reduced_sim(event_model: mla.models.EventModel, flux_norm: float = 0, gamma: float = - 2, sampling_width: Optional[float] = None) → numpy.ndarray¶

Gets a small simulation dataset to use for injecting signal.

Prunes the simulation set to only events close to a given source and calculate the weight for each event. Adds the weights as a new column to the simulation set.

Parameters

  • event_model – Preprocessed data and simulation.

  • flux_norm – A flux normaliization to adjust weights.

  • gamma – A spectral index to adjust weights.

  • sampling_width – The bandwidth around the source dec to cut events.

Returns

A reweighted simulation set around the source declination.

signal_spatial_pdf(events: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.array¶

Calculates the signal probability of events.

Gives a gaussian probability based on their angular distance from the source object.

Parameters

events – An array of events including their positional data.

Returns

The value for the signal spatial pdf for the given events angular distances.

inject_background_and_signal(reduced_sim: numpy.ndarray, event_model: mla.models.EventModel, nsignal: Optional[int] = None, signal_time_profile: Optional[mla.time_profiles.GenericProfile] = None, background_time_profile: Optional[mla.time_profiles.GenericProfile] = None, background_window: Optional[float] = 14) → numpy.ndarray¶

Inject both signal and background

Parameters

  • reduced_sim – Reweighted and pruned simulated events near the source declination.

  • event_model – EventModel that holds the grl and data

  • n – Number of events(Optional,use spectrum to get the nsignal if not pass.)

  • signal_time_profile – The time profile of the injected signal

  • background_time_profile – Background time profile to do the injection

  • background_window – Days used to estimated the background rate

Returns

Array containing injected signal and background

reduced_sim(event_model: Optional[mla.models.EventModel] = None, sim: Optional[numpy.ndarray] = None, flux_norm: Optional[float] = 0, gamma: Optional[float] = - 2, livetime: float = None, spectrum: Optional[mla.spectral.BaseSpectrum] = None, sampling_width: Optional[float] = None) → numpy.ndarray¶

Function info…

Prunes the simulation set to only events close to a given source and calculates the weight for each event. Adds the weights as a new column to the simulation set.

Parameters

  • event_model – models.EventModel object that holds the simulation set

  • sim – simulation set. Alternative for user not passing event_model.

  • flux_norm – A flux normaliization to adjust weights.

  • gamma – A spectral index to adjust weights.

  • livetime – Livetime in days.It is equivalent of using flux per second instead of time-integrated flux.

  • spectrum – spectral.BaseSpectrum object.Alternative for user not passing flux_norm and gamma.

  • sampling_width – The bandwidth around the source declination to cut events.

Returns

A reweighted simulation set around the source declination.

set_background_profile(event_model: mla.models.EventModel, background_time_profile: mla.time_profiles.GenericProfile, background_window: Optional[float] = 14, withinwindow: Optional[bool] = False) → None¶

Function info…

Setting the background rate for the models :param event_model: EventModel that holds the grl :param background_window: Days used to estimated the background rate :param background_time_profile: Background time profile to do the injection :param withinwindow: Use data rate within time profile to estimate background rate

Returns

None

mla.models module¶

The classes in this file do preprocessing on data and monte carlo to be used to do a point source analysis.

class mla.models.EventModel(data: numpy.ndarray, sim: numpy.ndarray, grl: numpy.ndarray, background_sin_dec_bins: Union[numpy.array, int] = 500, signal_sin_dec_bins: Union[numpy.array, int] = 50, log_energy_bins: Union[numpy.array, int] = 50, gamma_bins: Union[numpy.array, int] = 50, verbose: bool = False)¶

Bases: object

Stores the events and pre-processed parameters used in analyses.

Currently, this class uses internal data and monte-carlo datasets. This will be updated before the first release to use the upcoming public data release.

data¶

Real neutrino event data.

Type

np.ndarray

sim¶

Simulated neutrino events.

Type

np.ndarray

grl¶

A list of runs/times when the detector was working properly.

Type

np.ndarray

sin_dec_bins¶

An array of sin(dec) bin edges for the energy maps.

Type

np.array

log_energy_bins¶

An array of log(energy) bin edges for the energy maps.

Type

np.array

background_dec_spline¶

A spline fit of neutrino flux vs. sin(dec).

Type

scipy.interpolate.UnivariateSpline

log_sob_gamma_splines¶

A 2D list of spline fits of the log(signal-over-background) vs. gamma at a binned energy and sin(dec).

Type

List[List[scipy.interpolate.UnivariateSpline]]

property background_dec_spline¶

Getter for background_dec_spline.

property data¶

Getter for data.

get_log_sob_gamma_splines(events: numpy.ndarray) → List[scipy.interpolate.fitpack2.UnivariateSpline]¶

Gets the splines of sob vs. gamma required for each event.

Parameters

events – An array of events including their positional data.

Returns

A list of splines of sob vs gamma for each event.

property grl¶

Getter for GRL.

property sim¶

Getter for sim.

mla.time_profiles module¶

The classes in this file are example time profiles that can be used in the analysis classes. There is also GenericProfile, an abstract parent class to inherit from to create other time profiles.

class mla.time_profiles.CustomProfile(pdf: Callable[[numpy.array, Tuple[float, float]], numpy.array], time_range: Tuple[float], bins: Union[List[float], int] = 100, name: str = 'custom_tp')¶

Bases: mla.time_profiles.GenericProfile

Time profile class for a custom binned distribution.

This time profile uses a binned pdf defined between 0 and 1. Normalization is handled internally and not required beforehand.

window¶

The range of distribution function.

Type

Tuple[float]

pdf¶

The distribution function. This function needs to accept an array of bin centers and a time window as a tuple, and it needs to return an array of probability densities at the given bin centers.

Type

Callable[[np.array, Tuple[float, float]], np.array]

default_params¶

A dictionary of fitting parameters for this time profile.

Type

Dict[str, float]

param_dtype¶

The numpy dytpe for the fitting parameters.

Type

List[Tuple[str, str]]

dist¶

The histogrammed version of the distribution function.

Type

scipy.stats.rv_histogram

bounds(time_profile: mla.time_profiles.GenericProfile) → List[Tuple[Optional[float], Optional[float]]]¶

Given some other profile, returns allowable ranges for parameters.

Parameters

time_profile – Another time profile to use to get the bounds.

Returns

The fitting bounds for the parameters of this time profile.

Returns the initial parameters formatted for ts calculation output.

Returns

class mla.time_profiles.GaussProfile(mean: float, sigma: float, name: str = 'gauss_tp')¶

Bases: mla.time_profiles.GenericProfile

Time profile class for a gaussian distribution.

Use this to produce gaussian-distributed times for your source.

mean¶

The center of the distribution.

Type

float

sigma¶

The spread of the distribution.

Type

float

scipy_dist¶
Type

scipy.stats.rv_continuous

default_params¶

A dictionary of fitting parameters for this time profile.

Type

Dict[str, float]

param_dtype¶

The numpy dytpe for the fitting parameters.

Type

List[Tuple[str, str]]

bounds(time_profile: mla.time_profiles.GenericProfile) → List[List[float]]¶

Returns good bounds for this time profile given another time profile.

Limits the mean to be within the range of the other profile and limits the sigma to be >= 0 and <= the width of the other profile.

Parameters

time_profile – Another time profile to use to define the parameter bounds of this time profile.

Returns

A list of tuples of bounds for fitting the parameters in this time profile.

property default_params¶

Returns the initial parameters formatted for ts calculation output.

class mla.time_profiles.GenericProfile¶

Bases: object

A generic base class to standardize the methods for the time profiles.

While I’m only currently using scipy-based probability distributions, you can write your own if you want. Just be sure to define these methods and ensure that the PDF is normalized!

default_params¶

A dictionary of fitting parameters for this time profile.

Type

Dict[str, float]

param_dtype¶

The numpy dytpe for the fitting parameters.

Type

List[Tuple[str, str]]

abstract bounds(time_profile: mla.time_profiles.GenericProfile) → List[Tuple[Optional[float], Optional[float]]]¶

Get a list of tuples of bounds for the parameters of this profile.

Uses another time profile to constrain the bounds. This is usually needed to constrain the bounds of a signal time profile given a background time profile.

Parameters

time_profile – Another time profile to constrain from.

Returns

A list of tuples of bounds for fitting the parameters of this time profile.

abstract property default_params¶

Returns the initial parameters formatted for ts calculation output.

abstract logpdf(times: numpy.array) → numpy.array¶

Get the log(probability) given a time for this time profile.

Parameters

times – An array of times to get the log(probability) of.

Returns

A numpy array of log(probability) at the given times.

abstract property param_dtype¶

Returns the parameter names and datatypes formatted for numpy dtypes.

abstract pdf(times: numpy.array) → numpy.array¶

Get the probability amplitude given a time for this time profile.

Parameters

times – An array of event times to get the probability amplitude for.

Returns

A numpy array of probability amplitudes at the given times.

abstract random(size: int) → numpy.array¶

Get random times sampled from the pdf of this time profile.

Parameters

size – The number of times to return.

Returns

An array of times.

abstract property range¶

Gets the maximum and minimum values for the times in this profile.

Returns

A tuple of times.

abstract x0(times: numpy.array) → Tuple¶

Gets a tuple of initial guess to use when fitting parameters.

The guesses are arrived at by simple approximations using the given times.

Parameters

times – An array of times to use to approximate the fitting parameters of this time profile.

Returns

A tuple of approximate parameters.

class mla.time_profiles.UniformProfile(start: float, length: float, name: str = 'uniform_tp')¶

Bases: mla.time_profiles.GenericProfile

Time profile class for a uniform distribution.

Use this for background or if you want to assume a steady signal from your source.

mla.tools module¶

Functions that are generic enough to not belong in any class

mla.tools.angular_distance(ra1: float, dec1: float, ra2: float, dec2: float) → float¶

Calculates the angle between two points on the unit sphere.

Parameters

  • ra1 – The right ascension of the first point (radians).

  • dec1 – The declination of the first point (radians).

  • ra2 – The right ascension of the second point (radians).

  • dec2 – The declination of the second point (radians).

Returns

The distance, in radians, between the two points.

mla.tools.cross_matrix(mat: numpy.array) → numpy.array¶

Calculate cross product matrix.

A[ij] = x_i * y_j - y_i * x_j

Parameters

mat – A 2D array to take the cross product of.

Returns

The cross matrix.

mla.tools.read(filelist: List[str]) → numpy.ndarray¶

Reads in and concatenates a list of numpy files.

Parameters

fileList – A list of .npy file paths as strings.

Returns

An array of data events.

mla.tools.rotate(ra1: float, dec1: float, ra2: float, dec2: float, ra3: float, dec3: float) → Tuple[float, float]¶

Rotation matrix for rotation of (ra1, dec1) onto (ra2, dec2).

The rotation is performed on (ra3, dec3).

Parameters

  • ra1 – The right ascension of the point to be rotated from.

  • dec1 – The declination of the point to be rotated from.

  • ra2 – the right ascension of the point to be rotated onto.

  • dec2 – the declination of the point to be rotated onto.

  • ra3 – the right ascension of the point that will actually be rotated.

  • dec3 – the declination of the point that will actually be rotated.

Returns

The rotated ra3 and dec3.

mla.tools.to_unit_vector(r_a: float, dec: float) → numpy.array¶

Converts location on unit sphere to rectangular coordinates.

Parameters

  • r_a – The right ascension of the point on the unit sphere.

  • dec – The declination of the point on the unit sphere.

Returns

A numpy array of the x, y, and z coordinates of the point.
